sections.description: Different icons used throught the site, this file will be updated in the future, so please remember to update this module accordingly with the new icons when Greenstone adds new ones. These icons works as a normal font family, so you are able to change sizes and color as you want
Layer to create the different mixins for later use.
This includes all the third-party CSS used throughout the site. like normalize, grid system, bootstrap
These are element styles — no classes or IDs. Base typography styles go here, as well as anything needed to style raw elements. styles for transverse elements like h1, h2 ..., lists, etc.
These are our headings styles with 'Helvetica' font family

sections.description: a cosmetic layer — this is where we should include more specific styling instructions for objects. Without the components layer, the site would still have its structure, but would look like a gray-box wireframe.

This layer is mostly layout-driven, and doesn’t include anything cosmetic (backgrounds, colors etc..) this is not used for this example, since the components will include everything from markup to styles
Different buttons used throug the website under the Btn module, this module can be used for anchor and button tags

modifiers.name: .Btn--primary.Btn--inverse
modifiers.description: Creates a primary inverse green button

modifiers.name: .Btn--secondary.Btn--inverse
modifiers.description: Creates a primary inverse purple button

modifiers.name: .Btn--primary.Btn--block
modifiers.description: Set the button to be a block element and fill the parent width, can be used in conjuction with every button style

sections.description: Form styles used throug the website under the Forms module,
